user_request: see creations saved in the google photos
screen_desc: This screenshot displays a Google account menu on an Android device. It includes the account name and email at the top (Ellie Brennan), with options to manage device folders, access archives, and delete items from trash. There are also options to free up space, adjust settings, and open Google’s PhotoScan app. Below, there are options for Help & Feedback, as well as legal links to the Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.
history_actions: click on the Photos app located at the upper left.
click on the "Confirm" button located at the bottom of screen.
click on the menu icon (often represented by three horizontal lines, also known as the "hamburger" icon) located at the top left.

think_action.Thought: The user's request is to view their creations saved in Google Photos. From the current screen, the most logical step is to check the 'Device folders' option, as it often contains locally saved photos and creations. This option will likely lead to the appropriate section.
Future Action Plan: Click on 'Device folders' to view saved creations.
Locate and browse through the available folders for any saved creations.
